alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 1:54PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Yuma and northwestern Dundy Counties through 230 PM MDT... At 153 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles northeast of Wray, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Yuma and northwestern Dundy Counties, including the following locations... Alvin and Wauneta. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 247 and 270. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
